Article CARDINAL of LAW ( “ Retrospective effect of criminal law ” ) provides that where a new criminal law decriminalises an offence , provides for more lenient punishment or otherwise improves the situation of the offender it shall apply with retrospective effect to offences committed before it came into force , even where the offender is already serving sentence . If the new law provides for a shorter sentence , then the offender 's sentence must be reduced accordingly .
